hypothesis_content.title: Weekend Volatility Surge Fade in Neutral Regimes
hypothesis_content.statement: In NEUTRAL market regimes (as defined by FjordHQ regime classifier), when the Friday-to-Sunday realized volatility of BTC exceeds the Monday-Thursday volatility by a factor of 1.8x, selling volatility at Sunday's close (via short straddles) captures the predictable decay as weekday institutional flows resume and dampen price action.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Weekend trading is dominated by retail and Asian markets, often leading to exaggerated, low-liquidity moves. In neutral regimes without strong trends, these moves frequently reverse or consolidate when US/European institutional liquidity returns on Monday, causing volatility to mean-revert. The structural short gamma position of dealers amplifies this damping effect.
entry_conditions: Friday 16:00 ET to Sunday 23:59 ET BTC realized volatility > 1.8x * (Mon 00:00 ET to Fri 16:00 ET RV)
Sunday closing price is within ±3% of Friday's closing price
No major macroeconomic data releases scheduled for Monday US session

exit_conditions.take_profit: Position held until Friday 16:00 ET close (capture weekly theta)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price moves >6% from Sunday's close before Wednesday 23:59 ET

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If weekend volatility consistently remains elevated into the Monday-Wednesday period, or if Sunday's close is not a local volatility high point for the weekly cycle.
